text:
Some APIs with OAuth 1.0 implementations require having oauth_body_hash among oauth params when signing. 
Form-encoded requests are signed by design, so body hash is eligible only for request that are encoded in any other way.
Specification is described here: http://oauth.googlecode.com/svn/spec/ext/body_hash/1.0/oauth-bodyhash.html
title: Providing `oauth_body_hash` for bodies on non-form-encoded requests
